ingredients: 1.5-2 tbsp white or yellow miso paste
1 cup greens (spinach, chard, or bok choy), chopped
1 green onion, sliced (white and green parts)
1 sheet nori seaweed, cut into strips
instructions: In a medium pot, bring vegetable broth to a simmer
In a small bowl, whisk miso paste with a few tablespoons of hot broth until smooth
Add tofu cubes and greens to the simmering broth, cook 2-3 minutes
Add green onions and nori strips, cook 1 more minute
Remove pot from heat (important - don't boil miso after adding)
Stir in the miso paste mixture until well combined
Taste and adjust with soy sauce if needed
Serve hot, drizzled with sesame oil if desired

ingredients: Optional: chili powder or Tajín seasoning
instructions: Select mangoes that yield slightly to gentle pressure
Place mango on a cutting board
Slice off both sides (cheeks) as close to the pit as possible
Score the flesh in a crosshatch pattern, being careful not to cut through the skin
Push the skin from underneath to pop the cubes outward
Slice off the cubes or eat directly from the skin
Trim remaining flesh from around the pit
Arrange mango slices on a plate
Optional: squeeze fresh lime juice over
Optional: sprinkle with chili powder or Tajín
Optional: add a pinch of salt
Optional: garnish with mint leaves
Serve immediately for best freshness
Can be stored in refrigerator for up to 3 days

ingredients: 1/2 large onion, very finely chopped or grated
Optional: vinegar or soy sauce for dipping
instructions: Make dough: mix flour and salt, make a well in center
Add egg and water, gradually mix until dough forms
Knead for 5-8 minutes until smooth and elastic
Cover with plastic wrap, rest for 30 minutes
Make filling: mix beef, pork, onion, garlic, salt, and pepper
Mix thoroughly, you can use a food processor for finer texture
Refrigerate filling until ready to use
Roll dough thin on floured surface
Cut into 2-inch circles using a glass or cutter
Place 1/2 tsp filling in center of each circle
Fold in half to form a half-moon, press edges to seal
Bring corners together, pinch to form traditional pelmeni shape
Place on floured surface until ready to cook
Bring large pot of salted water to boil
Add pelmeni, stir gently so they don't stick
Cook for 7-10 minutes until they float
Remove with slotted spoon
Toss with butter, serve with sour cream and fresh dill
Optional: add vinegar or soy sauce for dipping

ingredients: 1/2 cup milk (dairy, almond, or oat milk)
instructions: Rinse buckwheat groats thoroughly until water runs clear
In a dry skillet over medium heat, toast groats for 3-4 minutes, stirring constantly
Bring water or broth to a boil in a medium pot
Add toasted buckwheat and salt, reduce heat to low
Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes until water is absorbed
Remove from heat, let stand covered for 5 minutes
Fluff with a fork
Stir in butter and milk until creamy
Optional: add sugar or honey to taste
Optional: top with fried onions for extra flavor
Serve warm as a side dish or simple breakfast

ingredients: 5 sheets roasted nori seaweed (or store-bought seaweed snacks)
Note: These are typically store-bought snacks
instructions: Easiest: purchase pre-made roasted seaweed snacks (nori) from Asian grocery store
For homemade version:
Preheat oven to 250°F (120°C)
Cut nori sheets into smaller squares or rectangles
Lightly brush both sides with sesame oil
Sprinkle with salt (and optional chili powder or sugar)
Place on baking sheet in single layer
Bake for 10-15 minutes until crispy
Let cool completely - they will get crispier
Store in airtight container with desiccant packet
Best consumed within 2-3 days
Serve as a healthy snack

ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Bring a pot of salted water to boil
Cut guanciale into small cubes or slices
Cook guanciale in a skillet over medium heat for 2-3 minutes until crispy, remove from heat and set aside
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated Pecorino Romano, and plenty of black pepper until creamy
Cook spaghetti al dente according to package instructions
Drain spaghetti, reserving some pasta water
Place spaghetti in the skillet with the guanciale over high heat to coat with rendered fat
TURN OFF THE HEAT completely
Pour egg and cheese mixture over hot pasta and stir quickly - the residual heat will create a creamy sauce
If too thick, add a splash of pasta water to loosen
Serve immediately, topped with extra guanciale, grated Pecorino Romano, and black pepper
recipe.source: Recipes from Italy - Authentic Roman Carbonara

ingredients: Pickled vegetables (pickled carrots, daikon, or cabbage)
Optional: fried shallots, chili oil, cilantro
instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear
In a large pot, bring broth, water, and ginger to a boil
Add rice, reduce heat to low
Simmer uncovered for 1-1.5 hours, stirring occasionally
Cook until rice breaks down and porridge reaches desired consistency
Add more water if needed for thinner consistency
Season with soy sauce and sesame oil
Prepare pickled vegetables on the side
Serve hot porridge garnished with chopped scallions
Serve pickled vegetables on the side
Optional: add fried shallots, chili oil, or cilantro as toppings

ingredients: 1 cup cottage cheese or farmer's cheese (tvorog)
1 tbsp sour cream or Greek yogurt
1/2 tbsp olive oil or sunflower oil
Optional: cucumber or tomato on the side
instructions: Place cottage cheese in a mixing bowl
Add sour cream or yogurt and mix well until smooth
Finely chop fresh herbs: dill, parsley, and chives
Add herbs to the cheese mixture
Add salt and black pepper to taste
Optional: add minced garlic for extra flavor
Drizzle with olive oil or sunflower oil
Optional: sprinkle with paprika
Mix thoroughly until well combined
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed
Serve as a spread on bread, or on its own
Optional: serve with cucumber or tomato slices on the side
Can be made ahead and refrigerated for 2-3 days

ingredients: 1/2 block (7 oz) firm or extra firm tofu, cubed
1/2 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp water
1/2 tsp Sichuan peppercorns, toasted and ground
instructions: Cut tofu into 1-inch cubes
Bring water to boil, add tofu and blanch for 2 minutes to remove moisture
Drain and set aside
Heat oil in wok or large pan over medium heat
Add ground pork, cook until browned, break up any clumps
Add chili bean paste, fermented black beans, garlic, and ginger
Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant
Add soy sauce, sugar, and chicken stock
Bring to a simmer
Add tofu cubes, gently stir to combine
Simmer for 5 minutes, letting tofu absorb flavors
Stir in cornstarch mixture to thicken sauce
Add dried red chilies and ground Sichuan peppercorns
Cook 1-2 more minutes
Garnish with sliced green onions
Serve hot over steamed rice

ingredients: 1/2 cup cottage cheese or farmer's cheese (tvorog)
instructions: Make the batter: whisk flour, eggs, milk, melted butter, sugar and salt until smooth
Let batter rest for 20-30 minutes
Make filling: mix cottage cheese, ricotta, egg yolk, sugar, and vanilla until combined
Optional: add raisins to the filling
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat, lightly grease with butter
Pour small ladle of batter, swirling to coat pan thinly
Cook until edges lift and bubbles form, about 45 seconds
Flip and cook 15-20 seconds more until set
Stack blini on a plate, keep warm
To serve, place 2-3 tbsp of cheese filling in center of each blini
Fold into quarters or roll up
Serve warm, topped with sour cream if desired

ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed nuts (almonds, walnuts, cashews, pecans)
1/2 cup mixed dried fruits (raisins, cranberries, apricots, dates)
Optional: dark chocolate chips or chunks
Optional: pumpkin seeds or sunflower seeds
Optional: cinnamon or cardamom for seasoning
instructions: Choose raw or roasted nuts according to preference
If nuts are raw, toast them in a dry pan for 3-5 minutes until fragrant
Let nuts cool completely
Chop large dried fruits (apricots, dates) into bite-sized pieces
Combine nuts and dried fruits in a bowl
Optional: add dark chocolate chips for extra indulgence
Optional: add pumpkin or sunflower seeds for variety
Optional: sprinkle with cinnamon or cardamom
Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks
Portion into snack-sized bags for easy grabbing

ingredients: 1/2 tbsp miso paste or 1/2 tsp salt
2 oz (57g) pork belly or chashu, sliced (optional)
Optional: chili oil, corn, bamboo shoots
instructions: Prepare soft-boiled eggs: boil eggs 6.5 minutes, cool in ice water, peel
In a large pot, bring broth to a simmer
Add soy sauce, miso paste (or salt), and 1/2 tbsp sesame oil
Cook ramen noodles according to package, drain and set aside
In the broth, add mushrooms and cook 2-3 minutes
Divide noodles among serving bowls
Ladle hot broth over noodles
Top with sliced pork (if using), halved soft-boiled eggs
Add bean sprouts, green onions, nori strips
Drizzle with remaining sesame oil and chili oil if desired
Serve immediately while hot

ingredients: 2 cups milk (dairy, almond, or oat milk)
1/2 cup mixed nuts (walnuts, almonds, pecans), chopped
Fresh berries or sliced banana for topping (optional)
Butter or extra honey for drizzling (optional)
instructions: Combine oats, milk, water, and salt in a medium saucepan
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally
Reduce heat to low and simmer 5-7 minutes until oats are soft and creamy
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla if using
Stir in honey and cinnamon
Divide oatmeal into serving bowls
Top generously with chopped nuts
Add fresh berries or sliced banana if desired
Drizzle with extra honey or butter if you like
Serve warm

ingredients: 2 apples (any variety - Granny Smith, Honeycrisp, Fuji)
4 oz (120g) cheese (cheddar, gouda, brie, or your favorite)
instructions: Wash apples thoroughly
Core apples and slice into wedges or rounds
Slice cheese into thin pieces or small cubes
Arrange apple slices on a serving plate or board
Place cheese alongside or on top of apple slices
Optional: drizzle with honey
Optional: sprinkle with chopped nuts and cinnamon
Serve immediately for best freshness

recipe.title: Shashlik (grilled meat) with salad
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

ingredients: 3/4 cup cottage cheese or farmer's cheese (tvorog)
2 tbsp butter or oil for frying
Optional: honey or jam for serving
instructions: Place cottage cheese in a bowl, mash with a fork
Add egg, sugar, salt, and vanilla, mix well
Add 2 tbsp flour, mix until combined
Optional: add raisins or dried cranberries
The dough should be slightly sticky but manageable
Place 1/4 cup flour in a shallow plate for coating
Take about 1 tbsp of dough, form into a small patty
Dredge both sides in flour, shake off excess
Repeat with remaining dough
Heat butter or oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat
Fry syrniki in batches for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown
Don't crowd the pan - cook 2-3 at a time
Transfer to paper towels to drain excess oil
Serve warm with sour cream, honey, or fresh berries
Can be served for breakfast or dessert

ingredients: 4 slices traditional Russian or Eastern European rye bread
3-4 tbsp butter (salted or unsalted to taste)
instructions: Slice rye bread into thick or thin slices according to preference
Bring butter to room temperature for easy spreading
Generously spread butter over each slice
Optional: sprinkle with coarse salt
Optional: rub warm bread with a cut garlic clove for extra flavor
Optional: garnish with fresh dill
Optional: serve with radish slices or cucumber on the side
Can be served as a simple breakfast, snack, or side dish
Best served at room temperature or lightly toasted

recipe.title: Chicken soup with vegetables
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

ingredients: 4 slices crusty bread (rye, sourdough or whole grain)
Optional: garlic cloves for rubbing bread
instructions: Heat butter or oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat
Crack eggs into pan, being careful not to break yolks
Season with salt and pepper
Cook until whites are set but yolks are still runny, 3-4 minutes
For over-easy, carefully flip and cook 30 more seconds
Toast bread until golden and crispy
Optional: rub warm bread with cut garlic clove
Place eggs on toast, garnish with fresh herbs if desired
Serve immediately while eggs are hot

ingredients: 1 cup daikon radish, cut into matchsticks
1/2 cup fresh young ginger, peeled and sliced paper-thin
Optional: yuzu peel or lemon zest
instructions: Cut daikon into thin matchsticks, about 2 inches long
Peel ginger and slice as thinly as possible (use a mandoline if available)
Place daikon and ginger in a clean glass jar
In a saucepan, combine rice vinegar, water, sugar, and salt
Optional: add dry white wine for sweetness
Bring to a simmer, stirring until sugar and salt dissolve
Let the brine cool completely
Pour cooled brine over daikon and ginger
Optional: add dried chili and yuzu peel
Make sure vegetables are completely submerged
Seal jar and refrigerate
Ready to eat after 24 hours, best after 2-3 days
Will keep refrigerated for 2-3 weeks

ingredients: 1/2 lb (225g) chicken thighs or breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 tbsp dry white wine (substituted for mirin)
1 tbsp dry white wine (substituted for sake)
1/2 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 1/2 tbsp water
instructions: Cook rice according to package instructions
Make teriyaki sauce: combine soy sauce, dry white wine, sugar, honey, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger in a bowl
Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat
Add chicken pieces, cook 5-6 minutes until browned
Add teriyaki sauce to the pan
Bring to a simmer, cook 3-4 minutes
Stir in cornstarch mixture to thicken sauce
Continue cooking 1-2 minutes until sauce coats chicken
Remove from heat
Serve chicken and sauce over steamed rice
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions
Optional: serve with steamed broccoli or other vegetables
